      77             : // Access modes for the first 4 operands. If there are more than
      78             : // four operands they use the same access mode as the 4th operand.
      79             : //
      80             : // u: unchanged
      81             : // r: (r)read access

     208             : // For PAGE2 and PAGE3 opcodes when using an an array of inst_page1 most
     209             : // entries have M680X_INS_ILLGL. To avoid wasting memory an inst_pageX is
     210             : // used which contains the opcode. Using a binary search for the right opcode
     211             : // is much faster (= O(log n) ) in comparison to a linear search ( = O(n) ).
     212           0 : static int binary_search(const inst_pageX *const inst_pageX_table,
     213             :         int table_size, uint8_t opcode)
     214             : {
     215           0 :         int first = 0;
     216           0 :         int last = table_size - 1;
     217           0 :         int middle = (first + last) / 2;
     218             : 
     219           0 :         while (first <= last) {
     220           0 :                 if (inst_pageX_table[middle].opcode < opcode) {
     221           0 :                         first = middle + 1;
     222             :                 }
     223           0 :                 else if (inst_pageX_table[middle].opcode == opcode) {
     224           0 :                         return middle;  /* item found */
     225             :                 }
     226             :                 else
     227           0 :                         last = middle - 1;
     228             : 
     229           0 :                 middle = (first + last) / 2;
     230             :         }
     231             : 
     232           0 :         if (first > last)
     233           0 :                 return -1;  /* item not found */
     234             : 
     235             :         return -2;
     236             : }

    1796             :         uint16_t address)

    1798           0 :         cs_m680x *m680x = &info->m680x;
